results.title: With the best of intentions
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Robin Hughes and Bill Steller
results.brief_description: This film looks at the lives of children growing up in different environments. Compares two professional Sydney families to show how broader social developments and conflicts are reflected in middle-class approaches to child rearing.

results.title: With music ring
results.brief_description: Featuring the Mormon Tabernacle Choir of 375 voices. Shows how the building of a great composite sound such as the Mormon Tabernacle Choir requires hard work and a man of talent on the podium.

results.title: With just a little trust
results.brief_description: An elderly black woman, her feet swollen with arthritis, marches with pride and determination through an urban ghetto to meet her daughter. Arriving ahead of her daughter, she finds an eviction notice on the door of the apartment - only the beginning of a veritable sea of troubles which mother and daughter meet together. Cast: Frances Williams, Barbara Iley.

results.title: With hand and heart
results.creator_credit: United States Information Service (Seoul, Korea) and Yang Seung Ryong
results.brief_description: Story of a Korean amputee, hopelessly depressed after losing his arms in the Korean War and fully dependent upon his family; his rehabilitation after he enters the Amputee Centre in Taejon, sponsored and financed by the American Church World Service, where he is given artificial arms and therapy leading to restoration of faith in himself. Finally he attends the Rural Institute where he is taught improved farming techniques.

results.title: With gentle majesty
results.brief_description: This film recalls the hey-day of the working horse at the turn of the century, and reflects on the decreasing number used today. The title is from Shakespeare’s lines: “Sometimes he trots, as if he told the steps, with gentle majesty and modest pride”. Narrated by Wynn Roberts. (Award: AFI Silver Award)

results.title: With a little friendly help
results.creator_credit: Department of Commercial and Industrial Development Queensland and Brian Benson
results.brief_description: Queensland’s Department of Industrial Development (DID) assists the development and production of innovation by establishing industrial estates. This film surveys the estates in Queensland and highlights some of the industries supported on these.

results.title: Witch doctor
results.brief_description: Choreographic interpretation of voodoo ritual performed by Haitian witch doctor, danced by Jean Leon Destine, to rid a woman possessed of an eil spirit. Accompanied by music of drums.

results.title: Wisconsin: the good life
results.creator_credit: Dick Durrance Films and Dick Durrance
results.brief_description: A survey of Wisconsin - touches briefly the story of the States and the present agricultural and industrial riches. Shows scenes of Milwaukee, an ocean-going port in the heart of the mid-west; Madison, the capital and centre of public life and the varied opportunities for winter and summer sports.

results.title: Wirritt wirritt [Italian version]: an Australian legend
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian news and Information Bureau and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Wirritt Wirritt
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Australian news and Information Bureau and Malcolm Otton
results.brief_description: The aboriginal legend of how fire came under man’s control, illustrated by aboriginal cave painting. The musical background was recorded in Arnhem Land by Professor Elkin. The story is that at first only one man could make fire, and jealously guarded it. However, by a trick Wirritt Wirritt (an ancestral hero) stole the secret for all men’s use. Narrated by Ray Barrett.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board, Australian news and Information Bureau and Malcolm Otton
